channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: “Learn How a Nuclear Submarine Works” Seminar Scheduled for September 18
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 6:00 PM - 8:00 PM - If you’ve ever wanted to know how a nuclear-powered submarine works, attend this session in the CBIS Isermann Auditorium for a discussion and Q&A opportunity! Like spacecrafts here on Earth, these amazing ships operate submerged and independent for months at a time; this session will focus on the submarines’ nuclear reactor, key engineering systems, and more.
item.author: Students

item.title: OGE Online Workshop to Offer Tips for Dissertation, Thesis Preparation and Submission
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 25, 2024 12:00 PM - 1:30 PM - This workshop will discuss the basics of correct thesis organization and format, appropriate paper attribution and reference citation styles, and review the most common mistakes and ways to avoid them. All students who will be writing a thesis or dissertation are welcome to register and get their questions ready!
item.author: Students

item.title: Thinking about Off-Campus Housing?
item.description: Date: Thursday, September 19, 2024 11:00 AM - 1:00 PM - Staff from the Off-Campus Commons will be available to answer juniors’, seniors’, and graduate students’ questions and offer information about the resources that are available in the Housing Search. Stop by to ask questions, and enter the raffle while you’re there!

item.title: BD Edge Program Student Information Sharing Virtual Session to be Held September 18
item.description: If you’re ready to bring your big ideas and ambitions to BD and make your contribution to their next innovation, attend this virtual session on Wednesday, September 18 from 5:30 pm to 7:30 pm for insights about working life at BD and their focus on developing new professionals. You’ll hear firsthand how BD’s early career professionals in the Edge Program (Technology & Global Services) are developing their own skills while supporting BD’s mission of advancing the world of healthTM.

item.title: Applications Now Being Accepted for Spring 2025 Resident Assistants
item.description: Student Living and Learning is looking for applicants to join their Spring 2025 staff. Apply now to join their team of leaders on campus and help create a community in your residence hall! Applications will be accepted from August 1 to October 4, 2024; qualified applicants will be required to attend both a group and individual interview in October. To learn more, sign up to attend an information session this Fall!

item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - During this seminar, Dr. Rachel Zhuojun Huang — of the Center for Materials for Water and Energy Systems, McKetta Department of Chemical Engineering, University of Texas at Austin — will give a presentation titled “From Li Extraction to Batteries: How Polymers Interact with Electrons, Ions, and Solvents.”

item.title: Retirement Reception for Paul Martin to be Held September 20
item.description: Date: Friday, September 20, 2024 2:00 PM - 4:00 PM - After more than 40 years of service at Rensselaer, Paul Martin will be retiring. The campus community is welcome to attend this reception being held in Paul’s honor, and to join the Administration Division in thanking Paul for his service to the Institute and wishing him well in his retirement.

item.title: Rajani Bhatia to Speak at STS Colloquium September 18
item.description: Scheduled from from 11:30am to 1pm in Sage 5711, this talk argues that, in the context of intensifying climate change impacts, populationist thinking and agendas tempt broad audiences by providing an easy scapegoat. Analyzing how mainstream and extreme rhetoric on population amplify one another, Bhatia turns to feminist critics of population control to affirm the possibility of another future based on the vision articulated by reproductive and environmental justice movements.

item.title: CEE Seminar to be Held September 18
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM - In a presentation titled “Physics-Informed Data Analytics Approaches Using Constrained Optimization - Exploiting Domain Knowledge with Hard Information in a Transportation Network,” Professor Dr. Yueyue Fan of University of California, Davis, will discuss how civil infrastructure as a system often faces challenges and complexity brought by interactions between spatially- and functionally- distributed components.

item.title: NYS Pollution Prevention Institute Student and Faculty Research Symposium Scheduled for September 20
item.description: Date: Friday, September 20, 2024 9:30 AM - 3:30 PM - Chemical and Biological Engineering is hosting the Second Annual NYS2PI Student and Faculty Research Program Symposium highlighting “Reagents of Change: Green Chemistry and Safer Chemicals in Products and Industry.” The program includes keynote speakers, student-led project presentations and a poster session, and breakfast and lunch. Register by September 16!

item.title: “Creating Basic Pivot Tables with Excel for Windows” Topic of Fac/Staff Quick Learn Webinar
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 10:30 AM - 11:00 AM - If you’re an instructor or staff member who works with data in Excel and you’re always manipulating the content with filters and sorting, Pivot Tables in Excel might be for you! Register to join Office of Undergraduate Education’s Maureen Fodera as she discusses using Pivot Tables to work with data, apply basic functions, and include charts.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Faculty/Staff In-Person Workshop to Offer Deeper Dive into Active Learning Approaches
item.description: Date: Monday, September 30, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Focusing on the three active learning concepts of the Jigsaw activity, Think/Pair/Share and working with Concepts Maps, this workshop will discuss the concept of each approach and give examples to help attendees think about how they might be able to incorporate the various approaches into their class as an activity. Please registerif you plan to attend!

item.title: CDPHP Nurse, Member Services Consultations Available to Faculty, Staff September 17
item.description:
Because Rensselaer’s Division of Human Resources and our partners at CDPHP, Inc. know how important it is to provide you with opportunities and support in answering questions about your health and medical plan benefits, faculty and staff enrolled in Rensselaer’s medical plans with CDPHP can meet in person with our dedicated nurse and/or a member services representative from noon to 3pm on Tuesday, September 17 at the Heffner Alumni House.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
